pr_title: DROOLS-5733 prevent removing trailing zeros for numbers in scientific…

timeline.message: DROOLS-5733 prevent removing trailing zeros for numbers in scientific notation

timeline.bodyText:
@tarilabs seems I was a bit too quick, we found another one 😅
There's probably a number of other solutions, such as using
String.format("%f", value)
instead of
value.toString()
If you'd prefer a different solution, let us know.
Overall, it's probably not a huge issue - normally, when dealing with large numbers with fractions, one should provide a BigDecimal as input value, instead of a float/double, anyways.
We just wanted to inform you that this bug exists. We're also fine with you closing this PR if you don't consider it imporant 🙂
timeline.author: j-beyer

replies.bodyText:
when dealing with large numbers with fractions, one should provide a BigDecimal as input value, instead of a float/double, anyways.

exactly, the recommendation is to supply a BigDecimal, as part of input DMNContext.
However, thank-you for mentioning this, and I concur if there is a way to improve the behaviour also when (mis)using the doubles anyway, why not!
Allow me some time on this one since I recall there was specific reasons we opted for the double->string->BigDecimal in the first place, so I just want to double check with that in mind.
Many thanks again for letting us know!
replies.author: tarilabs
TommyNeubert

replies.bodyText:
Unfortunately the solution of the comment
would be less ideal, since a call to
getBigDecimalOrNull(10.00000000D)

would cause to return a
new BigDecimal("1E+1")

rather then the most naturally expected:
new BigDecimal("10")

So far, the current PR proposal is the most preferable, but I am always open to discuss additional options! :)
replies.author: tarilabs

replies.bodyText:
If I'm not mistaken, the current PR proposal would show the same behavior that you described.
getBigDecimalOrNull(10.00000000D)

would also just internally convert the double to "1E+1" using toString(), and would pass that to the BigDecimal constructor as well. We just wouldn't strip any trailing zeroes after the E anymore.
Maybe the above metioned
String.format("%f", value)

would change this. We haven't checked the details of that yet, though.
replies.author: j-beyer

replies.bodyText: the current PR proposal works fine for me, let's merge this as-is and if later there are suggestion for further improvement we can always revise it. For now the most important part was to avoid the bug when the toString results in something ending with ...E10 or similar exponent ending with zero 👍
replies.author: tarilabs

timeline.bodyText:
Note: this assertion would break without the change.
value.toString()
will produce 1.00000000005E10, and removeTrailingZeros() would change this to 1.00000000005E1
